instructions:
Heat oven to 425 degrees.
Combine peaches *(with syrup)* and tapioca in saucepan and cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat
until mixture thickens and boils. Boil and stir one minute. Keep hot, stirring occasionally.
Combine baking mix, 2-tbsp sugar, 2 tbsp-melted butter and milk to a soft dough. Gently smooth dough
into a ball on well-floured cloth-covered board. Knead 8 to 10 times.
Roll dough into 9-inch square and spread with 2 tbsp melted butter. Mix 1/4 cup sugar and cinnamon;
sprinkle over square. Roll up; seal well by pinching edge of dough into roll.
Pour peach mixture into 8 x 8-inch Pyrex baking dish. Cut roll into 1 inch slices and place cut side up on
hot peach mixture. Bake 20 to 25 minutes in 425 oven.
name: Peach Whirligigs
creator: Mary Decker
